main event: Multiple witnesses reported an unidentified aerial object sighting in Walden, New York on 1 June 1949. The object was observed in the sky, resembling a chain-like formation with 5 or 6 balls of fire chained together, hanging vertically and drifting slowly northward. The sighting lasted approximately 15-20 minutes and no sound or odor was detected.
interesting points: The object resembled a chain-like formation with balls of fire, hanging vertically and drifting northward.
The altitude and distance from the observer were unknown, but the object was observed at an angle of approximately 45Â° overhead.
Multiple witnesses reported the same object, indicating a credible sighting.
No photographs or physical evidence of the object were obtained.
Weather conditions at the time of the sighting were reported as clear and cloudless, with a full moon and bright light.
sighted object: chain-like formation with balls of fire
